meanings.definition: Occurring or existing throughout the tropics.
meanings.sent1: The pantropical climate is warm and humid all year round.
meanings.sent2: Many birds have adapted to the pantropical environment.
meanings.sent3: The explorer was surprised by the pantropical rainforest's vastness.
meanings.sent4: Her love for travel was as pantropical as the lush forests she visited.
meanings.sent5: The idea of a pantropical paradise captured her imagination.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a plant or animal species that is found in tropical regions worldwide.
meanings.sent1: The pantropical species of fish can be seen in oceans around the globe.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the migration patterns of pantropical birds.
meanings.sent3: The zoo proudly displayed a collection of pantropical plants.
meanings.sent4: His knowledge of pantropical flora was as diverse as the ecosystems themselves.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the pantropical flowers was unmatched in the botanical garden.
